thread.title: Kiwi holds gains pending new Greek plan
thread.title_full: Kiwi holds gains pending new Greek plan

author: news.com.au
title: Kiwi holds gains pending new Greek plan
text:
THE New Zealand dollar has held onto its overnight gains in local trading as investors wait for the Greek government to put forward a debt proposal to European leaders.
THE kiwi traded at 67.30 US cents at 5pm in Wellington, from 67.27 cents at 8am and up from 66.43 cents on Wednesday.
The trade-weighted index rose to 71.03 from 70.31 on Wednesday. Greek Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras told European leaders he will submit detailed proposals to justify new funding after Greeks voted against adopting harsh austerity measures to access funding, which has heightened market sensitivity. "It feels like a bit of an environment where it's a bit dangerous to have any direction," said Sam Tuck, senior FX strategist at ANZ Bank New Zealand in Auckland. "Kiwi could squeeze a little bit more if things become more uncertain, but equally if things don't become more uncertain and China settles down a little bit, it looks like it will take a little for people to go back into their short positions." The kiwi advanced to 90.13 Australian cents at 5pm in Wellington from 89.76 cents on Wednesday, to 60.79 euro cents from 60.34 cents, to 81.68 yen from 81 yen and to 4.1796 Chinese yuan from 4.1246 yuan.
